qas.question: When was the west front of Saint Denis completed?
What portion of the reconstruction of Saint Denis was begun after the completion of the west front?
What style of nave was left unaltered during this portion of the reconstruction of Saint Denis?
What style of columns did Abbott Suger use when reconstructing Saint Denis?
What design element allowed the use of large clerestory windows?
When was the south front of Saint Denis removed?
What style of columns did Abbott Suger use when destructing Saint Denis?
What style of nave was fully altered during this portion of the reconstruction of Saint Denis?
What design element allowed the use of small clerestory doors?
What portion of the reconstruction of Saint Denis was delayed after the completion of the west front?

context: At the completion of the west front <a0_0>in <b5_0>1140<b5_0/><a0_0/>, Abbot Suger moved on to the reconstruction of <a1_0><b9_0>the eastern end<b9_0/><a1_0/>, leaving <a2_0><b7_0>the Carolingian nave<b7_0/><a2_0/> in use. He designed a choir that would be suffused with light. To achieve his aims, his masons drew on the several new features which evolved or had been introduced to Romanesque architecture, the pointed arch, the ribbed vault, the ambulatory with radiating chapels, the <a3_0><b6_0>clustered columns<b6_0/><a3_0/> supporting ribs springing in different directions and <a4_0><b8_0>the flying buttresses<b8_0/><a4_0/> which enabled the insertion of large clerestory windows.
